title: The Different Stages of Sannyasa | HH Stoka Krishna Swami
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: There are four stages of advancement in sannyas.
segments.summary: The lecture introduces the four stages of sannyasa: Kutichaka, Bahudaka, Parivrajaka, and Paramahamsa.

segments.key_quote: They can fully devote themselves for practicing tapasya, for studying the scriptures, for practicing austerity, etc.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the Kutichaka stage of sannyasa, where individuals live in a simple cottage and focus on spiritual practices.

segments.key_quote: Madhukari means the business of a bumble bee.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the Bahudaka stage, also known as Madhukari, comparing it to a bumble bee collecting nectar from many flowers.

segments.key_quote: Parivrajaka does not stay in one place.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the Parivrajaka stage, where sannyasis travel and preach, adhering to strict rules of not staying in one place for more than three days.

segments.key_quote: Devotees who are fully devoted to serving Krishna without caring for any personal comforts, they are actually, paramahamsas
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the Paramahamsa stage, emphasizing pure devotion to Krishna and explaining how the essence of sannyasa is adapted for preaching in Kali Yuga.
